name: phosphoric acid production, dihydrate process | phosphoric acid, fertiliser grade, without water, in 70% solution state | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22551/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of phosphoric acid, with 51% P2O5. Phosphoric acid is an ancillary product, mainly used in the fertiliser manufacturing industry to produce phosphorous containing fertilisers. Phosphate rock and sulphuric acid are the raw materials to produce phosphoric acid. Phosphate minerals are digested with an acid. There are several technologies to manufacture phosphoric acid, the main ones being the hemihydrate and the dihydrate processes. The hemihydrate process is more energy efficient while the dihydrate process is more simple to operate. In this dataset, a combination of the dihydrate and the hemihydrate production processes is represented in a proportion of 80% (dihydrate) to 20% (hemihydrate). An average transport distance of the phosphate rock to the phosphoric acid plant is included with the respective fuel demand and assumed by tanker and train.;The main data source for this dataset is Fertilizers Europe (2000), complemented by Althaus et al (2007).;References:;Kongshaug G. (1998): Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions in Fertilizer Production. IFA 20th July 1998;Davies J., Haglund C. (1999): Life Cycle Inventory of Fertiliser Production. SIK-Report No 654 1999. Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden.;Fertilizers Europe (2000): Best Available Techniques for Pollution Prevention and Control in the European Fertilizer Industry. Booklet No. 2 of 8: Production of Phosphoric acid. Fertilizers Europe, Brussels.;Patyk R., Reinhardt, G.A. (1997): Düngemittel - Energie- und Stoffstrombilanzen. Vieweg Verlag, Braunschweig.;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Average Emissions Year 2014. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal). Used for updated energy and GHG emission in Carbon Footprint Calculator;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product. Phosphate rock, sulfuric acid, quicklime, electricity and steam are included. Direct emissions to air and water are included.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data were collected on fertiliser production for the year 2011. These data were based on annual average data for the year 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset is representative of phosphoric acid production in Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This datasets corresponds to a mix of technologies used in Europe for phosphoric acid production, assuming 80% following the dihydrate process and 20% the hemihydrate process.
